net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.field

Class UiWidgetCustomFieldAtomic<VALUE,DELEGATE_VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetField<DELEGATE_VALUE>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.UiWidgetCustom<VALUE,DELEGATE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.field.UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE>
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.field.UiWidgetCustomFieldAtomic<VALUE,DELEGATE_VALUE,DELEGATE>
  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value. Typically a custom Datatype.
    DELEGATE_VALUE - is the generic type of the delegates value.
    DELEGATE - is the generic type of the delegate.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadTrimValue, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadValueAsString, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteTrimValue, AttributeWriteValidationFailure, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteValueAsString, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidgetField<VALUE>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetRegularComposite<UiWidget>, UiWidgetWithValue<VALUE>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>

    public abstract class UiWidgetCustomFieldAtomic<VALUE,DELEGATE_VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetField<DELEGATE_VALUE>>
extends UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE>
    This is the abstract base class for a custom field widget that is build out of a single field widget.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • doGetValue

        protected final VALUE doGetValue(VALUE template,
                                 ValidationState state)
                          throws RuntimeException
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValue(). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. The following cases have to be distinguished:
        • For native fields this method has to get the actual value from the underlying native widget (text-box, password-field, etc.).
        • For custom fields this method will be responsible to convert from the delegates value (see UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()) to the proper value type. E.g. if you want to create a custom widget to edit your own datatype such as CustomerNumber based on a UiWidgetTextField you need to convert from String to CustomerNumber.
        • For custom composite widgets you should use AbstractUiWidget.getDataBinding(). UiDataBinding.createAndBind(net.sf.mmm.util.pojo.path.api.TypedProperty) that gives you high-level support and makes your live easy. Then there is no need to override this method.
        • For other cases, especially if <VALUE> is Void, there is nothing to do here.
        The implementation of this method has to correspond with the implementation of AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean) .
        Overrides:
        doGetValue in class AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May only be null if according to data-binding (e.g. if <VALUE> is an (immutable) Datatype).
        state - is the ValidationState. May be null (if the validation is omitted). Should only be used to propagate to AbstractUiWidget.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState) of children.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If <VALUE> is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) the template is NOT null and is to be returned by this method after the value(s) of this widget have been assigned. For immutable datatypes template will be null and this method has to create a new instance of <VALUE> based on the end-users input in the widget.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean)

      • convertValueFromDelegate

        protected abstract VALUE convertValueFromDelegate(DELEGATE_VALUE value)
        This method converts the given value from the delegate widget to the value of this widget. This typically has to be implemented with your custom datatype conversion. In case that <VALUE> and <DELEGATE_VALUE> are the same you can just return the given value.
        A typical implementation shall look like this: 
         protected MyDatatype convertValueFromDelegate(String value) {
   return new MyDatatype(value);
 }
        Parameters:
        value - is the value of the delegate. Never null.
        Returns:
        the converted value of this widget.

      • convertValueForDelegate

        protected abstract DELEGATE_VALUE convertValueForDelegate(VALUE value)
        This method converts the given value that is going to be set in this widget to the value of the delegate widget. This typically has to be implemented with your custom datatype conversion. In case that <VALUE> and <DELEGATE_VALUE> are the same you can just return the given value.
        A typical implementation shall look like this: 
         protected String convertValueForDelegate(MyDatatype value) {
   return value.getValue().
 }
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to convert. Never null.
        Returns:
        the converted value for the delegate widget

      • convertValueToString

        protected String convertValueToString(VALUE value)
        Converts the given value to String.
        Overrides:
        convertValueToString in class AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to convert.
        Returns:
        the String representation to display the given value.

      • getNullValueForDelegate

        protected DELEGATE_VALUE getNullValueForDelegate()
        This method gets the value for the delegate widget in case null is provided as value for this widget. The default implementation return null. Override to change.
        Returns:
        the null-value.

      • doSetValue

        protected final void doSetValue(VALUE value,
                                boolean forUser)
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiWidget.setValue(Object, boolean). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. For details see AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState).
        Overrides:
        doSetValue in class AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to set. Typically a composite object (e.g. java bean) so its attributes are set to fields (see UiWidgetField).
        forUser - true if called from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValueForUser(Object), false if set from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValue(Object).
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState)

      • isTrimValue

        public boolean isTrimValue()
        This method determines if the value of this object should be automatically trimmed. The default value is true. E.g. if a text field widget supports this property and it is true the value entered by the end-user will automatically be trimmed. If you want prevent this (e.g. if the end-user shall provide a separator, indentation, substitution variable, or the like) you need to set it to false.
        Returns:
        true if the value of this object should be automatically trimmed.

      • setTrimValue

        public void setTrimValue(boolean trimValue)
        This method sets the trimValue flag.
        Parameters:
        trimValue - is the new value of AttributeReadTrimValue.isTrimValue().

      • removeFocusHandler

        public final boolean removeFocusHandler(UiHandlerEventFocus handler)
        This method removes the given UiHandlerEventFocus from this object.
        Specified by:
        removeFocusHandler in interface UiFeatureFocus
        Overrides:
        removeFocusHandler in class UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetField<DELEGATE_VALUE>>
        Parameters:
        handler - is the UiHandlerEventFocus to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the handler has been removed successfully, false if it was NOT registered and nothing has changed.

      • getFirstField

        protected UiWidgetField<?> getFirstField()
        This method gets the first active field contained in this custom field. This can be the delegate itself but also a child of the delegate in case of a composite custom field.
        Specified by:
        getFirstField in class UiWidgetCustomField<VALUE,DELEGATE extends UiWidgetField<DELEGATE_VALUE>>
        Returns:
        the UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()
